fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.computers

Class ComputerDynamicState

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.upmc.datacenter.hardware.computers.ComputerDynamicState
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataOfferedI.DataI, fr.upmc.components.interfaces.DataRequiredI.DataI, ComputerDynamicStateI, TimeStampingI, java.io.Serializable

    public class ComputerDynamicState
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComputerDynamicStateI
    The class ComputerDynamicState implements objects representing a snapshot of the dynamic state of a computer component to be pulled or pushed through the dynamic state data interface.

    Description

    Invariant

    TODO: complete! 
     invariant              timestamp >= 0 && timestamperIP != null
 invariant              computerURI != null && reservedCores != null

    Created on : April 23, 2015

    Version:
    $Name$ -- $Revision$ -- $Date$
    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String computerURI
      URI of the computer to which this dynamic state relates.
      protected boolean[][] reservedCores
      reservation status of the cores of all computer's processors.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      protected long timestamp
      timestamp in Unix time format, local time of the timestamper.
      protected java.lang.String timestamperIP
      IP of the node that did the timestamping.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ComputerDynamicState(java.lang.String computerURI, boolean[][] reservedCores)
      create a dynamic state object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getComputerURI()
      return the computer URI.
      boolean[][] getCurrentCoreReservations()
      return a boolean 2D array containing true in each cell (p,c) if the core c of processor p is currently reserved and false otherwise.
      long getTimeStamp()
      return the time at which the state has been gathered in local system time (currentTimeMillis). in milliseconds.
      java.lang.String getTimeStamperId()
      return the string representation of the IP address of the host on which the timestamp has been taken.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
